item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 1:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok goes dark in the US (730 points | 1148 comments)
2. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (109 points | 61 comments)
3. "The Traitors", a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (39 points | 18 comments)
4. Kalman Filter Tutorial (314 points | 66 comments)
5. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (183 points | 115 comments)
6. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (16 points | 3 comments)
7. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (48 points | 15 comments)
8. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (162 points | 30 comments)
9. VS Code Pets (408 points | 107 comments)
10. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (66 points | 10 comments)
11. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (122 points | 61 comments)
12. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (81 points | 39 comments)
13. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (462 points | 165 comments)
14. Hologram: A full-stack isomorphic Elixir web framework (85 points | 22 comments)
15. Japan's elderly are lonely and struggling. Some women choose to go to jail (20 points | 8 comments)
16. Reverse Engineering a VanMoof E-Shifter – Part 2 – Decoding the Signals (20 points | 4 comments)
17. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (67 points | 37 comments)
18. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (173 points | 85 comments)
19. Alignment faking in large language models (3 points | discuss)
20. How I built this website on a Raspberry Pi (96 points | 51 comments)
21. Why do bees die when they sting you? (290 points | 213 comments)
22. Beating cuBLAS in Single-Precision General Matrix Multiplication (90 points | 8 comments)
23. Tracing Military Command Chains Through Time and Location (62 points | 7 comments)
24. Boosting Computational Fluid Dynamics Performance with AMD MI300X (30 points | 13 comments)
25. Generating an infinite world with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (226 points | 62 comments)
26. Properties and Far-infrared Variability of a z = 7 Blazar (5 points | discuss)
27. Second-Hand Bookshops in Britain: 2024 Report (71 points | 25 comments)
28. WASM GC isn't ready for realtime graphics (120 points | 63 comments)
29. The AMD Radeon Instinct MI300A's Giant Memory Subsystem (198 points | 84 comments)
30. Dusa Programming Language (Finite-Choice Logic Programming) (149 points | 33 comments)
